revised_title: Protecting St. Paul's Cathedral from Lightning Damage
tldr: The Dean and Chapter of St. Paul's Cathedral requested the Royal Society's opinion on the best method to secure the cathedral from lightning damage. A committee, including Benjamin Franklin and other experts, proposed a plan to create a complete metallic communication system throughout the building to prevent damage from lightning strikes. The plan involved connecting various metal components, such as crosses, iron rods, and leaden pipes, to ensure a continuous electrical pathway from the top of the structure to the ground.
